info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 27 at 8:32PM MST until December 28 at 11:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST TUESDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Northwest Plateau and Northwest Deserts above 4000 feet. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Icy and snow covered roads are likely in the mountain terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The primary concern will be along Interstate 40 east of Kingman, where accumulating snowfall on the roadway is possible near Fort Rock. Additional areas of concern include Hualapai Mountain Road, State Route 66 east of Kingman, and State Route 389 from Colorado City to Fredonia, where roadway snow accumulations will result in dangerous travel conditions.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Expect snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
